intro: Rosa gallica f. trigintipetala, commonly known as the thousand-petaled rose, is a rare and ornamental hybrid of Rosa gallica. It is characterized by its exceptionally large, semi-double to fully double flowers with numerous petals, often reaching up to 300 petals per bloom. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is cultivated for its striking floral display. It typically grows as a shrub with thorny stems and dark green foliage. Due to its rarity and aesthetic value, it is highly sought after by horticulturists and botanical enthusiasts.
